title: Sri Lanka gilt yields slightly ease
snippet: Sri Lanka's bond yields in the secondary market down slightly while the rupee remains inactive in the forex market on Thursday, market participants said. Sri Lanka's interbank forex markets are not allowed to deal above 200 to the US dollar and import customers are not allowed to be given dollars above 203 to the US dollar in curbs announced after money printing triggered forex shortages.

title: SC suspends the operation of Deradicalization Regulations
snippet: The Supreme Court today issued an Interim Order suspending the operation of Prevention of Terrorism (De-radicalization from holding violent extremist religious ideology) Regulations No. 01 of 2021, which was published by way of a gazette notification on 12 March,

title: Krunal Pandya Back Home After Mandatory Quarantine In Sri Lanka, Tests Negative For COVID
snippet: Indian all-rounder Krunal Pandya has returned to India after completing his mandatory quarantine in Sri Lanka. Krunal Pandya had tested positive for COVID-19 during India's tour to Sri Lanka and had to miss the second and third T20Is along with other cricketers who came in close contact with him.

title: Mathews and Karunaratne overlooked for Sri Lanka Cricket Invitational T20 League
snippet: Experienced Sri Lankan cricketers Angelo Mathews and Dimuth Karunaratne have not been included the recently-announced squads for the SLC Invitational T20 League, which begins on August 12 in Pallekele.

title: Job losses and reduced income affecting families in Sri Lanka
snippet: COVID-19 related job losses and reduced incomes are making it harder for families in Sri Lanka to feed themselves, the United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) said today. WFP is supporting the Gover

title: Remembering Mauritius's worst environmental disaster
snippet: A year on, questions surrounding a massive oil spill from a bulk carrier near the island nation's shores remain.

title: Another 94 deaths reported in Sri Lanka
snippet: Another 94 coronavirus related deaths have been reported in Sri Lanka, the Ministry of Health said. The latest deaths had occurred yesterday (4th August) and were confirmed today as being linked to the virus.

title: Travel restrictions only solution to contain COVID: SLMA
snippet: The imposition of travel restrictions would be the only solution to contain COVID-19 in short term, the Sri Lanka Medical Association (SLMA) said. ..

title: COVID scare prompts Sri Lanka's Colombo Grand Mosque to cancel Friday prayers
snippet: Sri Lanka's Colombo Grand Mosque announced to local Muslims in its vicinity that Jummah prayers on Friday (06) will not be conducted due to the ongoing COVID-19 situation. The epidemic situation in Sri Lanka has worsened dramatically over the weeks,

title: Air France Focuses On The Caribbean And Europe This Winter
snippet: Air France confirmed its main focus for the winter 2021 season will be Europe and the Caribbean. The airline will focus on leisure destinations with six new routes as well as the continuation of seven summer routes.

title: Issuing passports limited after several staffers test COVID-19 positive
snippet: Issuing passports under the normal service has been temporarily suspended after several staff members of the Department of Immigration and Emigration Head office in Battaramulla have tested positive for COVID-19.

title: India Failed to Fulfil Its Obligations but Wants Sri Lanka to 'Fully Implement' 13th Constitutional Amendment
snippet: With increasing Chinese influence in Sri Lanka, the Indian government is lately trying to use Sri Lanka's "non-implementation" of the 13th amendment to the constitution to provide more autonomy to Tamil areas of the island as agreed 34 years ago,
